page.title: 10Famous People
page.content: William Alexander Smith was born in October 1854 at Pennyland Farm,Thurso. He founded The Boys' Brigade in 1883 while living in Glasgow, although it is claimed he formed the first company of boys in Thurso when he was only 11 years old. The movement was begun to bring religion and discipline into every boy's life. Centenary celebrations took place in 1983. There is a granite memorial set into the wall of Pennyland House. Robert Dick who came to Thurso in 1830 lived in a house near the harbour.He rediscovered the Northern Holygrass which was thought to be extinct. His famous collection of insects, plants, rocks and fossils can be seen in Thurso Museum.He had a considerable knowledge of botany and geology. The public erected a memorial to his memory in Thurso churchyard.
